intro: Copaifera krukovii, commonly known as Brazilian copaiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its long, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is known for its aromatic resin, which has been used traditionally in medicine. Copaifera krukovii typically grows in humid, tropical environments and can reach heights of up to 15 meters. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various species and contributing to the biodiversity of its native region.
